file_content.text: Careful. The Old Man....
Good luck, stranger.
By now, you've talked to Milosh. I hope he gave you what you need to find the village, because I've done all I can.
Even sent everything I know about the Eagle's network to Intelligence.
But now I'm leaving, because I know how this ends. After the ghost cell is neutralized, you turn me in.
I like you... but I can't trust you. You're an Imperial, and I'm a "terrorist."
Oh, I had a few doubts. You don't seem awful. But you're still an Imperial, and I know where your loyalties lie.
I can't give myself up to a life of torture. I mean to keep resisting the Empire. Maybe join up with the Republic. Something.
Anyway. Destroy the village. Kill the Old Man. They're not part of the resistance. They're something evil.
Cipher? If she's gone... what do we do now?
I used to blow things up, too, but I don't get self-righteous about it.
Anyway, what now? We're down by one.
We go to the Exchange drop point and find the terrorist village. Same as before.
This doesn't change anything.
Understood. A pity she left, though... we would've liked to've changed her mind about the Empire.
Works for me. Let's get going.
Imperial Intelligence will find her. In the meantime, we have work.
She can't hide forever.
We're better off without her. She was trouble.
Be glad Mia's gone.
Understood. We'll follow your lead to the Exchange drop point.
Got it. Check out the drop point, next? Get ourselves a ride to the terror cell....
Hello. I'm recording this message for you. Funny thing is, I don't know your name.
Be careful going to Milosh's home. He'll have protection.
I told you I tracked down Dragon Eyes? Your trap led straight to the terrorist supplier.
Real nasty sort named Milosh Varta. He works for the local crime syndicate--group called "the Exchange."
Why would the Exchange supply terrorists?
What's the link?
What's the Exchange's role on Tatooine?
The Exchange?
Been a while since I dealt with the underworld. I'm out of practice.
Criminals. My favorite.
I don't know a lot about them. The Exchange runs spice, gambling, extortion... broken legs and blown-up speeders.
Not a shock their guy is connected to the ghost cell. Milosh must get supplies through Mos Ila and ship them to the village.
We need to know how he does it. I'll pay him a visit.
He's our man, then.
So--I need to get a hardened criminal talking about his terrorist clients. Is that all?
Can't anything be simple?
You make it sound so easy.
After the cantina, Milosh could have assassins prepared. Or he might be dead.
He might be expecting me.
I don't think the cell has figured out what's happening yet.
I'm sure he has Exchange protection, but his house isn't far. Afterwards, we can meet back here.
You made it. Huh. I had a detonator primed just in case--I can probably turn it off, now.
I could do without being blown to bits by an ally.
I'd appreciate it.
Suppose so.
Mia. You seem a little on edge.
Are you okay?
Sorry. Sitting here while the cell's watching, relying on an Imperial to help me--it makes me restless. And it's only a matter of time....
As soon as I stop being useful, I'm dead. Or in Imperial custody--same thing.
The more you resist, the worse it'll be. But help us and you'll be treated well.
Cooperate and it'll be easier.
No one's going to hurt you. You have my word.
You're wrong.
Nice to hear, even if it isn't true. Back to work.
True enough.
So long as I'm around, you keep your weapons powered down. Clear?
No weapons, fool!
Right. Because you're all the protection I need.
You think I'm sticking around on this planet for fun? You think I like working with Imps?
I committed myself to taking down the ghost cell, but that doesn't mean you can treat me like dirt.
Are we going to work together, or are we going to argue?
Tone it down.
Right. Let's get the work done.
Apologies.
Apology accepted. Let's move on.
You're a terrorist, and I'm cleaning up your mess. Be glad you're useful.
I'll do what I have to.
At least we're honest with each other. Back to work.
Hello? Still alive out there?
Still alive. Can't say the same for the ghost cell hit team.
I'm fine.
Sweet of you to ask. You're getting attached.
[Flirt] Worried about me?
Are you--what? Never mind.
Our "perfect ambush" got complicated. Still, the job's done.
It was a little rough.
That's something, anyway.
One of the assassins looked like you. Care to explain?
I met your duplicate.
What? Blast.
The ghost cell is very good at... imitation. Holograms. The Old Man is better--not surprised he trained someone to be me.
A disguise like that isn't easy to pull off. I should know.
Impressive.
Well, maybe you and the Old Man can exchange tips sometime.
Your duplicate wanted to get up close and personal. Then she wanted to kill me.
She was... friendly.
I... see. Don't expect an ex-terrorist was very tempting for you.
She was a lot friendlier. Until she tried to kill me.
I liked her more.
We're not in this to be friends, are we? I know what you think of terrorists.
How do I know you're the real Mia? You could be another fake.
How can I trust you?
I brought you in with a mouse droid. We talked about the village. I warned you in the cantina. Good enough?
Now, while you were fighting, I think the tracers got a lock on Dragon Eyes.
Let's meet up before this call gets intercepted. There's a trading post near our man's location; I can make it there.
Just don't get killed on the way. Where do we meet?
All right.
If it's dangerous, I can meet you back in town.
Stay put.
That's--no. It's okay. After what you just did, the ghost cell will be distracted at least a little.
Send me his coordinates. I'll handle this.
Tell me where he is.
I'm tempted, but I still have something to contribute. Shrug me off later.
I'll wait for you in one of the storage areas. Should be safe, if you're quick, and if--I have to go.
It's time to bait the trap. The cantina's the best place to start... we need to draw out Dragon Eyes.
I don't know where the village is--they kept us sedated coming and going. But I had a thought.
The cell gets food and supplies from some smuggler in town--name of "Dragon Eyes." If we can flush him out, he can lead us there.
We make noise, Dragon Eyes takes the bait.
You want to set a trap.
Exactly.
Someone we could lean on for information.
Sounds useful.
Not my skill, but I've... had friends who were leaned on by Intelligence. They talked.
Is this a joke? I ask you to deliver assassins, and you give me a merchant?
The supplier isn't my concern.
Not just a merchant. Someone with a way in!
I patched together these tracking devices. Wouldn't be hard to plant them on customers in the local cantina--people who know things.
Then you ask around for Dragon Eyes, loud and public. Someone's bound to try and warn him, and with the trackers, we can see who.
Believe me, I can make a scene.
This could be fun.
I start asking questions, I'll expose myself.
There's risk involved.
I know. But if someone targets you, we know it's working.
How sure are you that someone will actually catch on?
I'm skeptical.
I'm not sure at all--but it's a place to start, right?
I'll monitor the trackers and call you when someone gets in touch with Dragon Eyes. But... work fast, okay?
Keep your weapons down. I don't want a fight, I just--you sure you weren't followed?
I followed your instructions, and I was watching all the way. We're safe.
I wasn't followed.
Safe. All right.
I need to know who I'm talking to. Weapons stay out until then.
Identify yourself!
Okay. I'm not going to cause trouble.
Even if I was followed, you're not going anywhere. Understand?
I'm in charge now.
I said I don't want to fight. Damn it--okay. Look, I'm backing off.
Aw, she's scared! Who needs a hug?
My name is Mia Hawkins. I'm not giving you the runaround, it's just--the ghost cell can look like anyone. Holographic disguise.
Holographic disguises will only get you so far.
That's quite a claim.
They're not--let me start over.
Just stay calm.
Sure. From the beginning.
They may be good, but no one's that good.
You're being paranoid.
You really don't get it, do you?
I used to be part of Cobalt Flag--the anti-occupation group on Sullust. We fought the Empire, organized bombings and sabotage... didn't work.
Last year, Imp security cracked down. Most of us died. I was... approached by people who offered me a way out. Retraining.
They were part of the ghost cell.
And those rescuers...
No. Just members of the Eagle's network who pointed the way.
Don't make it sound like you were a victim. You killed people.
You were a terrorist.
Cobalt Flag always issued warnings before attacks. If civilians died, it wasn't our fault!
Look, I don't want to get into a political argument. I did what I had to, but right now we've got the same goals.
You may be able to help, but it doesn't excuse what you've done.
Don't think this is over.
I'm not looking for excuses.
I suppose.
We're wasting time.
Right. Moving on, then.
So your buddies died while you joined the elite. Good deal.
Lucky for you.
Stop it. It wasn't like that.
The Eagle's people smuggled me to Tatooine, brought me to this weird empty village in the middle of the desert.
The ghost cell lived there--a few dozen fighters from around the galaxy, training under their leader. The Old Man.
No real name, I take it?
"The Old Man"?
Now we're getting somewhere.
He was... ancient. Brilliant. He taught us how to move unseen, kill anyone.
I'm going to eliminate those people. You're going to help me.
Those are our targets.
I understand. You need to know what you're up against, though.
The Old Man's village was an empty model. We could experiment with bombs, sniper fire, whatever. I spent months there.
Then they started kidnapping civilians. Brought them to the village so we could "practice." That's when I slipped away.
A whole town mocked up so you could learn terrorism.
You trained on real people.
Horrible.
With your past, I'm surprised you had such a weak stomach.
I thought you'd be tougher.
Those people were innocent. There are limits, there--the ghost cell has to stop.
Stay back if you know what's good for you.
